newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: ALPINE SKIING-ALPHAND COLLECTS FIRST SUPER-G WIN.
newsitem.headline: ALPINE SKIING-ALPHAND COLLECTS FIRST SUPER-G WIN.

text.p: Downhill specialist Luc Alphand won the first super-G race of his World Cup career on Wednesday.
The Frenchman threw down the gauntlet for next week's world championships with a winning time of one minute 25.23 seconds, 0.12 seconds faster than runner-up Josef Strobl of Austria.
Italy's Peter Runggaldier finished third in 1:25.63.
The race was the last men's speed event before the world championships in Sestriere, Italy, where the men's super-G will open the action on Monday.

Alphand, who suffered a bad crash in Laax the last time the resort hosted a super-giant slalom, won the downhill World Cup last season but had never finished better than second in the super-G before Wednesday.

Strobl, who set the fastest time on the upper part of the course but lost out with a mistake lower down, should have guaranteed himself one of the four Austrian places on the world championship super-G squad with his result.
